description: From Middle English ungloven, equivalent to un- +‎ glove.

verbs.description: unglove (third-person singular simple present ungloves, present participle ungloving, simple past and past participle ungloved)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To remove a glove or gloves (from).
examples: Long hours have to and fro let creep the sand, / Since I was tangled in thy beauty's web, / And snared by the ungloving of thine hand. —
